comment: Couldnt recommend him more. Great lecturer, very knowledgeable. From a political philosophy standpoint he is one of the best professors I have ever had.

comment: He is very good at responding to emails and is always willing to help. He is very lecture-heavy, so if you can not just sit and listen to someone talk, this is not the class for youlots of reading as well. Take at your own risk.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Syllabus said discussion posts & midterm, we never had any. He would only post lectures with only audio no notes. His quizzes are what makes up your grade. Questions are impossible no amount of AP classes could prepare you for the awfully worded run on questions. He did not tell us this until finals week. He stopped posting a month before..

He assigns a lot of reading, which is needed to get A's on the weekly quizzes. I took a hybrid, so our quizzes were online every Friday. I didn't take notes or read one time during the whole semester, and I also don't know anything about government, but I still managed to make a high B. The class is easy and he's a cool professor. Be on time!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Classes are VERY lecture heavy. He does not tell you when his tests will be on the syllabus, he announces the dates in class. His tests are timed and offered online and you MUST read to pass them. There are only three tests. He is a nice guy and is very smart, but his lectures are dense. However, I would not say he is a difficult professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Great guy. Funny, caring, and really wants you to succeed. Never thought Id be interested in a lick of American government, but this guy somehow made it interesting and enjoyable. Would highly recommend taking him if you have the chance.

Honestly my favorite class kind and fun professor easy class, do what he says and you will get an A. Philosophy heavy class, about the ideas behind creating the government. Short reading online, quizzes made the week of only covering what was done in class, no lockdown browser on anything, quiz every Friday, 2 tests online . No papers.

Super nice guy. I took hybrid so read a short story and then discuss in class and then short 10 question quiz every Friday online. no lockdown. Very heavy and boring lectures. You will really enjoy this class if you love philosophy!!!! Not a fan of it. The readings were kinda interesting. Go to class and be on time.
